commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Co-Authored-By: qingszhao <zhao.daqing@99cloud.net>
Co-Authored-By: 98k <18552437190@163.com>

Change-Id: I85e5f1437c0962ba089e767987e2be0c64d36433

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-01 16:19:35.000000000', 'message': "Make ES Curator schedule multinode-friendly

In the spirit of Kolla-Ansible, we generally try to provide
workable defaults.
The default for Elasticsearch curator schedule was fine except for
multinode deploys where it would cause all nodes to run at the
same time producing broken runs (race condition in the get-delete
cycle).
It is easy to improve this situation by embracing poor-man's
reimplementation of keystone's fernet key rotation schedule.
ES Curator does not need all the complexity of the former so it
can be handled very well by shifting by as many hours as the
instance's index dictates. It should rarely if ever need more time
(most likely still in minutes range rather than hours).

Change-Id: I9d6758c8550308d13d936de1a14afbe4124e593b
(cherry picked from commit b82eb1b3936dd305f9826c5d23655273fa10bb0e)
"}]
commit_message:
Make ES Curator schedule multinode-friendly

In the spirit of Kolla-Ansible, we generally try to provide
workable defaults.
The default for Elasticsearch curator schedule was fine except for
multinode deploys where it would cause all nodes to run at the
same time producing broken runs (race condition in the get-delete
cycle).
It is easy to improve this situation by embracing poor-man's
reimplementation of keystone's fernet key rotation schedule.
ES Curator does not need all the complexity of the former so it
can be handled very well by shifting by as many hours as the
instance's index dictates. It should rarely if ever need more time
(most likely still in minutes range rather than hours).

Change-Id: I9d6758c8550308d13d936de1a14afbe4124e593b
(cherry picked from commit b82eb1b3936dd305f9826c5d23655273fa10bb0e)

commit_message:
Use public interface for Magnum client and trustee Keystone interface

While all other clients should use internalURL, the Magnum client itself
and Keystone interface for trustee credentials should be publicly
accessible (upstream default when no config is specified) since
instances need to be able to reach them.

Closes-Bug: #1885420
Change-Id: I74359cec7147a80db24eb4aa4156c35d31a026bf

commit_message:
ironic-standalone, use http basic auth for json-rpc

This change achieves functional test coverage for using http_basic
auth for json-rpc requests.

Since json-rpc is aimed at standalone environments, using http_basic
instead of keystone auth for internal requests is a more realistic
test scenario.

For now, ironic-standalone-redfish is left with the inherited keystone
auth strategy.

Change-Id: I993741684eaa8f237ffb20535da7167bc589e72c
Story: 2007656
Task: 39827

[{'created': '2020-07-01 14:46:51.000000000', 'message': 'Set a chunk size for Fluentd bulk log upload to Monasca

In Fluentd v0.12, both the in memory and file buffer chunk size default
to 8MB. In v1.0 the file buffer defaults to 256MB. This can exceed the
Monasca Log or Unified API maximum chunk size which is set to 10MB.
This can result in logs being rejected and filling the local buffer
on disk.

Change-Id: I9c495773db726a3c5cd94b819dff4141737a1d6e
Closes-Bug: #1885885
Co-Authored-By: Sebastian Luna Valero <sebastian.luna.valero@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Set a chunk size for Fluentd bulk log upload to Monasca

In Fluentd v0.12, both the in memory and file buffer chunk size default
to 8MB. In v1.0 the file buffer defaults to 256MB. This can exceed the
Monasca Log or Unified API maximum chunk size which is set to 10MB.
This can result in logs being rejected and filling the local buffer
on disk.

Change-Id: I9c495773db726a3c5cd94b819dff4141737a1d6e
Closes-Bug: #1885885
Co-Authored-By: Sebastian Luna Valero <sebastian.luna.valero@gmail.com>

yeah, I agree that we should cleanup VMs also.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2020-01-16 04:07:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2020-01-16 05:47:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-01-16 15:31:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-01-17 07:59:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2020-01-17 09:27:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Oh, sorry, seems I haven't been clear enough. I'd drop both unstack.sh and clean.sh, just dump your instance and install a fresh one when you are done.

Anything else would require someone to set up a job that verifies that a stack/clean/stack cycle actually does work properly."}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-01-17 12:42:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

makes sense for now, though I agree with the other comments - this cleanup should be cleaned up'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-01-20 08:18:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> seems I haven't been clear enough. I'd drop both unstack.sh and clean.sh, just dump your instance and install a fresh one when you are done.
> 
> Anything else would require someone to set up a job that verifies that a stack/clean/stack cycle actually does work properly.

Is this just because of the lack of test coverage?

IMHO I believe unstack.sh or cleanup.sh is useful for local developments, so I would like to have clean.sh at least.

I am not sure what is a common pattern in development. I usually develop a patch in a different directory from /opt/stack. I re-run stack.sh (and unstack.sh) when I test the patch including the setup of OpenStack. If we only supports stack.sh (without unstack.sh or clean.sh), we always need to prepare a different machine and configure an access to the development machine.

I also usually use a baremetal machine (with something ironic or ubuntu maas). Deployments of baremetal machines tend to be longer compared to VMs in general, If we need to prepare a fresh machi, it means it forces me to wait longer."}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2020-01-20 08:51:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Lack of test coverage combined with lack of developers and reviewers, so IMO reducing scope where possible is a good thing. I do agree that that local development workflow is useful, so if someone cares enough in order to actually implement the testing, that would seem a good enough criterion to me to keep it.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-05-02 00:51:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Is there any action in my side? Do we need a new job to test unstack.sh?
I would like to hear opinions from the qa team.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2020-07-02 10:04:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Let's merge this, it doesn't change the global situation much.

It would still be nice to test the whole cleanup/restack cycle at some point."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-15 02:15:16.000000000', 'message': 'Cleanup VM instances during unstack

Currently VMs created by a previous DevStack run still exists even
after re-run stack.sh. This leads to a failure in launching a VM after
the second run of stack.sh. We need to check the reason of the failure
by nova compute log and clean up remaining VMs. It is annoying.

IIRC we cleaned up existing VMs. While I failed to identify which commit
changed this behavior, I believe it is worth recovering it.

This commit changes unstack.sh to call cleanup_nova. cleanup_cinder()
already cleans up LVM volumes and some of them may be used by VMs,
so I believe it is reasonable to clean up VMs in unstack.sh.

Change-Id: I9fcbc5105e443037fada1ef6a76a078145964256
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup VM instances during unstack

Currently VMs created by a previous DevStack run still exists even
after re-run stack.sh. This leads to a failure in launching a VM after
the second run of stack.sh. We need to check the reason of the failure
by nova compute log and clean up remaining VMs. It is annoying.

IIRC we cleaned up existing VMs. While I failed to identify which commit
changed this behavior, I believe it is worth recovering it.

This commit changes unstack.sh to call cleanup_nova. cleanup_cinder()
already cleans up LVM volumes and some of them may be used by VMs,
so I believe it is reasonable to clean up VMs in unstack.sh.

Change-Id: I9fcbc5105e443037fada1ef6a76a078145964256

Thanks, Julia!

'umount' takes '-a' as well, wouldn't that be sufficient when called at the very end?

Alternatively, we could also restrict things to '-t vfat': this would mount the partitions we are interested in (EFI) and not interfere with any of the bind mounts.

Thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2020-06-19 20:22:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Thanks, Julia!
 > 
 > 'umount' takes '-a' as well, wouldn't that be sufficient when
 > called at the very end?
 > 
 > Alternatively, we could also restrict things to '-t vfat': this
 > would mount the partitions we are interested in (EFI) and not
 > interfere with any of the bind mounts.
 > 
 > Thoughts?

So umount -a should work it looks like.  We would likely have to consider accepting failures, although I'd worry about breaking the ramdisk before rebooting... umount -a -t vfat && umount -a -t ext3 maybe?"}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2020-06-19 20:23:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > Thanks, Julia!
 > >
 > > 'umount' takes '-a' as well, wouldn't that be sufficient when
 > > called at the very end?
 > >
 > > Alternatively, we could also restrict things to '-t vfat': this
 > > would mount the partitions we are interested in (EFI) and not
 > > interfere with any of the bind mounts.
 > >
 > > Thoughts?
 > 
 > So umount -a should work it looks like.  We would likely have to
 > consider accepting failures, although I'd worry about breaking the
 > ramdisk before rebooting... umount -a -t vfat && umount -a -t ext3
 > maybe?

Looks like there is a -l option too!"}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2020-06-19 20:50:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Plane "umount -a" unmounts more than we mounted (devtmpfs), unless we do it after the other unmounts.

"umount/mount -a -t vfat" should be enough for the case I try to deal with: running grub for bios mode on a bios/uefi image, and it should not interfere with anything else ... should :)

Do you think "-l" would be better/helpful?'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2020-06-22 09:08:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2020-06-22 09:15:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2020-06-30 12:46:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2020-06-30 16:21:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2020-06-30 16:28:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

considering that this is a bug-fix, we might want to add a release note
looks good otherwise'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2020-06-30 16:32:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2020-06-30 16:34:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks, Riccardo. Not sure this is a bug fix. This is more to cover the special case of a BIOS/UEFI CentOS image (where the grubenv file is on the ESP).'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2020-07-01 22:05:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

Sounds good to me if it solves the issues you guys are hitting.'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2020-07-02 08:50:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Mount all vfat partitions before calling grub2

In order to ensure grub2 finds all files it needs, mount all
vfat partitions specified in the deployed image.

Story: #2007618
Task: #39629
Change-Id: Ie5b6e0abc3f266409562f9ecb26538126b667056

commit_message:
Fix the Elasticsearch Curator cron schedule run

There were two issues with it. Lack of /usr/local/bin in PATH
for CentOS and wrong crontab path for Ubuntu/Debian.
This patch mirrors how it is handled in keystone.

Change-Id: Ib54b261e12c409d66b792648807646015826e83c
Closes-Bug: #1885732
(cherry picked from commit 852c7a32c3a00d88243ef3b89ce19e6391a676b1)

(1 comment)

Do you want to import initial content with history?'}, {'account_id': 27329, 'date': '2020-06-29 07:36:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27329, 'date': '2020-06-29 07:36:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 27329, 'date': '2020-06-29 07:36:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-06-29 07:39:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27329, 'date': '2020-06-29 08:02:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 27329, 'date': '2020-06-29 08:27:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Published edit on patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-06-29 08:39:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Let me ask again:

 > Do you want to import initial content with history?

Note that you will start with an empty repository. Your very first
patch needs to setup the repository and add all infrastructure so that
the jobs pass (this can be done with a cookiecutter project).

Also, you can import an existing repository including it's history if
you have one. Once the repository is created, importing is not
possible anymore, changes will have to go through the normal review
process.

If you have a lot of history to import, please use the upstream field
instead of creating a repository and then pushing the patches one at a
time. Pushing a large number of related patches all at one time causes
the CI infrastructure to slow down, which impacts work on all of the
other projects using it. After repo creation the infra team will not
push any content to it; this is your only chance to import directly.

Please confirm that starting with an empty repo is fine."}, {'account_id': 27329, 'date': '2020-06-29 12:14:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Hello Andreas,

sorry I forgot to mention. For me it is fine starting a repository from scratch. I don't have any history to keep.

| Your very first patch needs to setup the repository and add all 
| infrastructure so that the jobs pass (this can be done with a
| cookiecutter project).

I am interested in knowing more regarding these first steps.

| Please confirm that starting with an empty repo is fine.

I confirm you it is fine. I will submit some incremental patches to it copying code (not much) from another repo, without caring about its history.

Thank you"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-06-29 12:31:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

> Hello Andreas,
 > 
 > sorry I forgot to mention. For me it is fine starting a repository
 > from scratch. I don't have any history to keep.


good, then this is fine as is.

 > | Your very first patch needs to setup the repository and add all
 > | infrastructure so that the jobs pass (this can be done with a
 > | cookiecutter project).
 > 
 > I am interested in knowing more regarding these first steps.

Just add a .zuul.yaml file with either noop-jobs (for both check and gate) or add real jobs, happy to review a change if you run into problems."}, {'account_id': 27329, 'date': '2020-07-01 05:48:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Thank you very much Andreas!'}, {'account_id': 27329, 'date': '2020-07-01 05:48:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-07-01 05:50:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Federico, why did you rebase? That is not needed at all - gerrit automatically rebases before test/merge.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-07-01 09:52:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

Hi Federico,

Nice to see tobiko here.
Do not hesitate to ping me if you need on the releases and associated processes.

Cheers'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2020-07-02 05:43:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 27329, 'date': '2020-07-02 10:22:35.000000000', 'content': 'Created a revert of this change as I77b91dd03a28f8960d7294c1ef086f4b46b02ccd'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-29 06:13:18.000000000', 'message': "Create a new repository for Tobiko DevStack plugin

Tobiko project repo (x/tobiko) grown fast since past few years
and from since a simple Python framework adquired additional
components that could be considered separate sub projects.

One of them is its DevStack plugin. As Tobiko can today connect
to an DevStack deployed cloud without requiring any configuration
this plugin has become optional and there this change serves
to the need of migrating it to its own location.

This new repo should also serve as location for DevStack related
Zuul jobs that are intended for running Tobiko test cases
against a DevStack provided cloud on OpenDev CI.

It this way we would also remove Zuul's dependency of Tobiko
main project jobs from DevStack project jobs helping making
a more granular an rational use of CI resources at the time
of submitting new changes to Tobiko main repo itself by triggering
build only when changing the framework or test cases, while
ignorin the rest of related dayly changes.

Change-Id: I8ec33cefd5a83fe111d4d9b58c4088ef4b990dbe

commit_message:
Create a new repository for Tobiko DevStack plugin

Tobiko project repo (x/tobiko) grown fast since past few years
and from since a simple Python framework adquired additional
components that could be considered separate sub projects.

One of them is its DevStack plugin. As Tobiko can today connect
to an DevStack deployed cloud without requiring any configuration
this plugin has become optional and there this change serves
to the need of migrating it to its own location.

This new repo should also serve as location for DevStack related
Zuul jobs that are intended for running Tobiko test cases
against a DevStack provided cloud on OpenDev CI.

It this way we would also remove Zuul's dependency of Tobiko
main project jobs from DevStack project jobs helping making
a more granular an rational use of CI resources at the time
of submitting new changes to Tobiko main repo itself by triggering
build only when changing the framework or test cases, while
ignorin the rest of related dayly changes.

Change-Id: I8ec33cefd5a83fe111d4d9b58c4088ef4b990dbe

commit_message:
Glance: setup cinder store for glance_store gate functional test

When GLANCE_STORES and GLANCE_DEFAULT_STORE environment variables
are set, this will setup the stores and default_store based on
them. Otherwise, it will enable stores based on enabled services,
as it has done so far.

This will be used to enable glance cinder store for the
glance_store's functional test job.

Change-Id: Iefe09e6915b4e073d6b95bca9c20fde33bf3af79
Needed-by: I20dec7ec28844bb03887917320a7d1da296e36d7

commit_message:
updated the command to create a stack user with passwordless privilages

It is easier to use create-stack-user.sh script than remembering or typing the
stack user creation script , this commit replaces the command for adding a
stack user and giving passwordless privilage , to using the
create-stack-user.sh script.

Closes-Bug:#1722995
Implements: creation of a stack user with passwordless privilages
Change-Id: Iadf56f5a8c09c5f0c33b8248da1e3989fbae13b4

[{'created': '2019-03-27 05:54:32.000000000', 'message': 'Add option for glance wsgi mode

Currently glance use wsgi_mode to control to use standalone mode or
in uwsgi mode which is global option that controls other service as
well.
Adding option for glance so that it can choose wsgi mode independantly
and favor standalone mode according to suggestion:
https://docs.openstack.org/glance/latest/admin/apache-httpd.html

Change-Id: I1f89a220c31c8b51a2276aacb2cf8084d6c313e8
'}, {'created': '2019-03-31 02:47:02.000000000', 'message': 'Add option for glance wsgi mode

Currently glance use wsgi_mode to control to use standalone mode or
in uwsgi mode which is global option that controls other service as
well.
Adding option for glance so that it can choose wsgi mode independantly.
Its default value is set to uwsgi for compatibility, but user should
favor standalone mode according to suggestion:
https://docs.openstack.org/glance/latest/admin/apache-httpd.html

Change-Id: I1f89a220c31c8b51a2276aacb2cf8084d6c313e8
'}]
commit_message:
Add option for glance wsgi mode

Currently glance use wsgi_mode to control to use standalone mode or
in uwsgi mode which is global option that controls other service as
well.
Adding option for glance so that it can choose wsgi mode independantly.
Its default value is set to uwsgi for compatibility, but user should
favor standalone mode according to suggestion:
https://docs.openstack.org/glance/latest/admin/apache-httpd.html

Change-Id: I1f89a220c31c8b51a2276aacb2cf8084d6c313e8

[{'created': '2018-11-03 03:14:05.000000000', 'message': 'Add Fedora 29 support

Fedora 29 has just released and it had not support on devstack
installation, support were only for fedora 27 and 29.
Running the stack.sh script threw an error that it has not been
tested on fedora 29, and asked to run it with FORCE=yes.

This change add Fedora 29 as a supported distro version.

Change-Id: I29b688681b019a3240837b3b592d48da7a9353da
'}]
commit_message:
Add Fedora 29 support

Fedora 29 has just released and it had not support on devstack
installation, support were only for fedora 27 and 29.
Running the stack.sh script threw an error that it has not been
tested on fedora 29, and asked to run it with FORCE=yes.

This change add Fedora 29 as a supported distro version.

Change-Id: I29b688681b019a3240837b3b592d48da7a9353da

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ib8eb67a379a228194bf9629e39b955727df0dd9b

commit_message:
Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Change-Id: Ieac31e5156510b652b111219de79f2f29db9dbf6
Sem-Ver: feature

messages:
[{'account_id': 32160, 'date': '2020-07-02 09:37:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2020-07-02 09:38:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Congratulations, you've proposed your first change in OpenDev.

Your submission will now be tested automatically by Zuul, our gatekeeper,
and reviewed by other friendly developers. They will give you feedback and
may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches often take days (and sometimes weeks) to get reviewed, so be
patient. Don't hesitate to ask for help, and answer questions about your
work promptly if you can. The more you get to know reviewers and get to be
known by them, the smoother the review and approval process will become. The
fastest way to accomplish this is by reviewing other proposed changes
yourself: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for participating in OpenDev, we look forward to seeing you
around.

Workflow Guide: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html"}, {'account_id': 32160, 'date': '2020-07-02 09:39:23.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Shūrù cuòwù
4/5000
input error'}]

commit_message:
I18n:Translation "Instance" error
https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/locale/zh_CN/LC_MESSAGES/django.po#L3506

On line 3505, msgid is "Instance ID=".
So on line 3506, msgstr should be translated as "实例 ID =" instead of "示例 ID ="

Change-Id: I4051150b6a1aac5525a1d82b2ea6905927b0e166

subject: Add a /healthcheck URL from oslo.middleware
messages:
[{'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2020-06-16 13:34:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2020-06-16 13:38:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Hasn't this been already implemented? Am I missing something? See https://review.opendev.org/#/c/711127/"}, {'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2020-06-16 13:48:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

At least for me, it wasn't there in Ussuri. Is this something that was done AFTER ussuri?"}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2020-06-16 14:08:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It's included in Ussuri. Make sure you enable it -- see https://docs.openstack.org/octavia/latest/admin/healthcheck.html"}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2020-06-16 15:03:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

As was already mentioned, this was already added to the Octavia API here: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/711127/ with documentation here: https://docs.openstack.org/octavia/latest/admin/healthcheck.html

We did not simply wrap the app as that would only test the wsgi framework (uWSGI in this case) and would not actually tell if the API was functional. Also, since this is an un-authenticated endpoint, it poses a slight security risk (it should have rate limiting in front of it, etc.), so we make it an opt-in feature.'}, {'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2020-07-02 09:21:45.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-16 13:34:24.000000000', 'message': 'Add a /healthcheck URL from oslo.middleware

in a nicer way for Octavia.

Change-Id: I7fbf063a5b49eeb556d9dc544d3853c34b235c03
'}]
commit_message:
Add a /healthcheck URL from oslo.middleware

This patch adds a /healtcheck URL so that operators can configure haproxy
in a nicer way for Octavia.

Change-Id: I7fbf063a5b49eeb556d9dc544d3853c34b235c03

commit_message:
CentOS/AArch64: RabbitMQ is back!

CentOS 8.2 has Erlang and RabbitMQ available in 'messaging/rabbitmq-38'
repository. We use it to grab Erlang while RabbitMQ comes from upstream
(like on x86-64).

Change-Id: I2559267d120081f2e5eabc9d966b019517a5ad5d

commit_message:
Document generation of an ansible configuration

Explain how to use:
openstack tripleo config generate ansible

Update the minimum recommended ansible config settings
and also provide an example for larger deployments.

Related-bug: #1883600

Change-Id: I04cf8c279a3abfeda73e8d373e074376d47af611
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
vmedia: fix TypeError when accessing a URL without content-disposition

We are calling a module like a function. Also add proper logging so that
we don't have to guess next time.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/738652/
Change-Id: Ic55577b1c4f7a84cb2ca282dde8ad2fee5faf3a5

[{'created': '2020-05-06 16:42:01.000000000', 'message': 'Allow to pass global request id in port and volume

Allow to pass global request id in port and volume

This change also allows passing ironic API microversion in places
where it was not possible previously, for consistency.

commit_message:
Use getfullargspec to inspect functions

The getfullargspec [1] function is maintained to provide compatibility
with the deprecatad getargspec [2].

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/inspect.html#inspect.getfullargspec
[2] https://docs.python.org/3/library/inspect.html#inspect.getargspec

Change-Id: Ibf78672c15702af43ed2ee1256517b1a1a895120

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-24 09:30:29.000000000', 'message': 'Untie the ramdisk deploy from AgentDeploy

Currently PXERamdiskDeploy inherits AgentDeploy, which is unnecessary
(it does not use in-band deploy steps or rely on heartbeats) and only
happens to work because AgentDeploy has only one deploy step, which
is not going to be the case soon.

This change extracts common code for tear down and cleaning from
ISCSIDeploy and AgentDeploy into the new AgentBaseMixin and makes
PXERamdiskDeploy inherit it instead.

Also removes the confusion AgentDeployMixin from iscsi_deploy.

Change-Id: Ia6c2e3d98d74fc9c64268db04bc2fb7f5a6f0c1c
Story: #2006963
Task: #40153
'}]
commit_message:
Untie the ramdisk deploy from AgentDeploy

Currently PXERamdiskDeploy inherits AgentDeploy, which is unnecessary
(it does not use in-band deploy steps or rely on heartbeats) and only
happens to work because AgentDeploy has only one deploy step, which
is not going to be the case soon.

This change extracts common code for tear down and cleaning from
ISCSIDeploy and AgentDeploy into the new AgentBaseMixin and makes
PXERamdiskDeploy inherit it instead.

Also removes the confusion AgentDeployMixin from iscsi_deploy.

Change-Id: Ia6c2e3d98d74fc9c64268db04bc2fb7f5a6f0c1c
Story: #2006963
Task: #40153

Add py38 in tox.

In new release, The project  is used  python38 to replace python37,
so drop py37,add py38 in tox.

subject: Make ES Curator schedule multinode-friendly
messages: [{'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-07-01 16:19:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-07-01 16:19:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked\n\nThis patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/train as commit 5011b6bd1effb123f221764fb40a5a7aef284e27'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-07-01 16:19:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2020-07-02 06:38:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-01 16:19:30.000000000', 'message': "Make ES Curator schedule multinode-friendly

In the spirit of Kolla-Ansible, we generally try to provide
workable defaults.
The default for Elasticsearch curator schedule was fine except for
multinode deploys where it would cause all nodes to run at the
same time producing broken runs (race condition in the get-delete
cycle).
It is easy to improve this situation by embracing poor-man's
reimplementation of keystone's fernet key rotation schedule.
ES Curator does not need all the complexity of the former so it
can be handled very well by shifting by as many hours as the
instance's index dictates. It should rarely if ever need more time
(most likely still in minutes range rather than hours).

Change-Id: I9d6758c8550308d13d936de1a14afbe4124e593b
(cherry picked from commit b82eb1b3936dd305f9826c5d23655273fa10bb0e)
"}]
commit_message:
Make ES Curator schedule multinode-friendly

In the spirit of Kolla-Ansible, we generally try to provide
workable defaults.
The default for Elasticsearch curator schedule was fine except for
multinode deploys where it would cause all nodes to run at the
same time producing broken runs (race condition in the get-delete
cycle).
It is easy to improve this situation by embracing poor-man's
reimplementation of keystone's fernet key rotation schedule.
ES Curator does not need all the complexity of the former so it
can be handled very well by shifting by as many hours as the
instance's index dictates. It should rarely if ever need more time
(most likely still in minutes range rather than hours).

Change-Id: I9d6758c8550308d13d936de1a14afbe4124e593b
(cherry picked from commit b82eb1b3936dd305f9826c5d23655273fa10bb0e)

subject: Check authorization before import for image
messages: [{'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2020-07-01 06:46:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2020-07-01 10:44:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2020-07-02 04:25:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-01 06:46:09.000000000', 'message': 'Check authorization before import for image

Right now we only check to see if the user can see the image before
we kick off an import operation. However, that will never work unless
the user is the *owner* of the image (or an admin) which means we
return a 202 to the API caller and then the task fails immediately.

This change makes us check that authorization up front and return an
appropriate error to the user so they know it failed, and avoid
starting a task destined for failure.

Note that there was already a check for a Forbidden result when calling
the import API. However, that used a context.owner=None which could never
happen in reality. A more suitable check would have been to use a context
with a different real owner, but it turns out that the task creation
would have succeeded in that case as well. This test is changed to use
an alternate owner and ensure that we get the forbidden result from the
new check immediately.

Change-Id: I385f222c5e3b46978b40bdefdc28fcb20d9c67d3
Closes-Bug: #1884587
(cherry picked from commit c930638fcf58b43d53903cfc30e06fd6919bdad6)
'}]
commit_message:
Check authorization before import for image

Right now we only check to see if the user can see the image before
we kick off an import operation. However, that will never work unless
the user is the *owner* of the image (or an admin) which means we
return a 202 to the API caller and then the task fails immediately.

This change makes us check that authorization up front and return an
appropriate error to the user so they know it failed, and avoid
starting a task destined for failure.

Note that there was already a check for a Forbidden result when calling
the import API. However, that used a context.owner=None which could never
happen in reality. A more suitable check would have been to use a context
with a different real owner, but it turns out that the task creation
would have succeeded in that case as well. This test is changed to use
an alternate owner and ensure that we get the forbidden result from the
new check immediately.

Change-Id: I385f222c5e3b46978b40bdefdc28fcb20d9c67d3
Closes-Bug: #1884587
(cherry picked from commit c930638fcf58b43d53903cfc30e06fd6919bdad6)

The managed inspection does not provide ipa-api-url and the ramdisk
cannot heartbeat, thus requiring a reboot. This change fixes it.

subject: Fixes minor issues in the read() retries patch
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-01 08:36:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes minor issues in the read() retries patch

Follow-up to commit c5b97eb781cf9851f9abe87a1500b4da55b8bde8.

Two things slipped through the cracks:
* ImageDownloadError was instantiated incorrectly, resulting in a wrong
  error message. This was uncovered by using assertRaisesRegext in tests.
* We allowed calling write(None). This was uncovered by avoiding sleep(4)
  in tests and enabling more failed calls before timeout.

Change-Id: If5e798c5461ea3e474a153574b0db2da96f2dfa8
(cherry picked from commit 00ad03b709275e185ccb5b8e80cb7db4b9071d56)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes minor issues in the read() retries patch

Follow-up to commit c5b97eb781cf9851f9abe87a1500b4da55b8bde8.

Two things slipped through the cracks:
* ImageDownloadError was instantiated incorrectly, resulting in a wrong
  error message. This was uncovered by using assertRaisesRegext in tests.
* We allowed calling write(None). This was uncovered by avoiding sleep(4)
  in tests and enabling more failed calls before timeout.

Change-Id: If5e798c5461ea3e474a153574b0db2da96f2dfa8
(cherry picked from commit 00ad03b709275e185ccb5b8e80cb7db4b9071d56)

commit_message:
Further cleanup unit tests

We changed all client workflows other than derived params
to not use mistral and zaqar. However, the unit tests still
mock lot of these. Let's remove those.

Change-Id: Ieddd97e73b1bd0f88b1fed17ac2575b3e2964e5f

commit_message:
Use setstr to  execute unittest test

The stestr[1] is parallel Python test runner designed to execute unittest test suites using multiple processes.
Test cases can be executed faster.

[1]https://github.com/mtreinish/stestr

Change-Id: Ic0b210685535f94a70a175385afdd9f399f4d690

commit_message:
Upadting horizon nodejs job name

Change I86a56afcd2cde3a088abcc66c0294424cd03546f updates horizon
nodejs job name and this patch to the same in horizon.yaml
so that nodejs job data is visible on grafana dashboard.

This patch also done a few cleaups:
- Remove py27 jobs.
- Remove python3-django111 jobs.
- Remove python3-django22 jobs.
- Added py38 and removed py37.

Change-Id: Iafdc2f77a627969a39370833f084cd7555da96fd

[{'created': '2020-06-05 08:49:01.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Allow use of ovn-sync mechanism driver

The ``neutron-ovn-db-sync-util`` replaces the ``ovn`` mechanism
driver with the ``ovn-sync`` mechanism driver. Subsequently it
makes calls into the OVN L3 service plugin.

At present the OVN L3 service plugin assumes the ``ovn`` mechanism
driver to be present and produces a Traceback when it is not.

This patch fixes that by testing for both of the supported
mechanism drivers.

Change-Id: I1ac685a12f49119f5ef1428cbc504b639d783803
Closes-Bug: #1882202

commit_message:
[OVN] Allow use of ovn-sync mechanism driver

The ``neutron-ovn-db-sync-util`` replaces the ``ovn`` mechanism
driver with the ``ovn-sync`` mechanism driver. Subsequently it
makes calls into the OVN L3 service plugin.

At present the OVN L3 service plugin assumes the ``ovn`` mechanism
driver to be present and produces a Traceback when it is not.

This patch fixes that by testing for both of the supported
mechanism drivers.

Change-Id: I1ac685a12f49119f5ef1428cbc504b639d783803
Closes-Bug: #1882202
Signed-off-by: Frode Nordahl <frode.nordahl@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Refactor ceph-ansible upgrade

ceph-ansible and python-tripleoclient have different "minimum" required
version of ansible in specification. This patch upgrades ceph-ansible as
prerequisite so all dependencies will be met. In fast-forward script
checks if ceph-ansible is installed.If yes, it will upgrade it to latest
versions in repositories.

Change-Id: I3eadfad34aa563084fd4cc68990cb247e734d508
Related-Bug: 1885637

[{'created': '2020-06-22 16:10:58.000000000', 'message': "Remove tht/tc/ta/tv update before UC upgrade.

After [0] merged, we are not required to run a tripleo-common,
tripleo-heat-templates, tripleo-ansible and tripleo-validations
package update as it will be performed by the undercloud upgrade
command itself.

This patch removes it from tripleo-upgrade. However, this can't be
backported to stable/train or older releases.

[0] - https://github.com/openstack/python-tripleoclient/commit/55c99266c9b589de93e3191cdd4d147e722fdf4a

Change-Id: I25cbeab46f7eeb1d24b104d8bcc2883af68492b0
"}, {'created': '2020-06-22 16:11:28.000000000', 'message': "Remove tripleoclient/tht/tc/ta/tv update before UC upgrade.

After [0] merged, we are not required to run a tripleo-common,

package update as it will be performed by the undercloud upgrade
command itself.

commit_message:
Remove tht/tc/ta/tv update before UC upgrade.

After [0] merged, we are not required to run a tripleo-common,
tripleo-heat-templates, tripleo-ansible and tripleo-validations
package update as it will be performed by the undercloud upgrade
command itself.

This patch removes it from tripleo-upgrade. However, this can't be
backported to stable/train or older releases.

[0] - https://github.com/openstack/python-tripleoclient/commit/55c99266c9b589de93e3191cdd4d147e722fdf4a

Change-Id: I25cbeab46f7eeb1d24b104d8bcc2883af68492b0

commit_message:
turn off NetworkManager in CentOS-8 TripleO

NetworkManager is restarting unexpectedly during
deployments of TripleO. Ensure the service is
disabled prior to deployment

Partial-Bug: #1885286
Change-Id: I67501aaaf34c8fdfa09da37e0e0a3eb6982cff3a

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-01 13:08:56.000000000', 'message': 'Set short ANSIBLE_SSH_CONTROL_PATH_DIR for all ceph roles

We set ANSIBLE_SSH_CONTROL_PATH_DIR to deal with permissions
issues. Bug 1885917 was introduced because it was set to a
variable which can make the path too long for a Unix domain
socket. We can fix it by hard coding it to something short
which will not vary.

Change-Id: I57d5a8bb8b125727983df188968ae19366c3ebd4
Closes-Bug: #1885917
'}]
commit_message:
Set short ANSIBLE_SSH_CONTROL_PATH_DIR for all ceph roles

We set ANSIBLE_SSH_CONTROL_PATH_DIR to deal with permissions
issues. Bug 1885917 was introduced because it was set to a
variable which can make the path too long for a Unix domain
socket. We can fix it by hard coding it to something short
which will not vary.

Change-Id: I57d5a8bb8b125727983df188968ae19366c3ebd4
Closes-Bug: #1885917

commit_message:
Use IRONIC_VM_SPECS_RAM from ironic-base in ipv6 job

2G is no longer enough and we have no need to set it
differently to the global value.

Change-Id: I25e6457b8cb93ea4c64c28437869c339fdddf8b2

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-29 18:44:09.000000000', 'message': 'Fix drop databases issue in Postgresql restore

Recently, the Postgresql backups were modified to generate drop database
commands (--clean pgdumpall option). Also for single database restore,
a DROP DATABASE command was added before the restore so that the
database could be restored without duplicate rows. However, if there are
existing database connections (by the applications or other users), then
the drop database commands will fail. So for the duration of the restore
database operation, the databases being restored need to have their
existing connections dropped and new connections prevented until the
database(s) restored, then connections should be re-allowed.

Also found a problem with psql returning 0 (success code) even though
there were errors during its execution. The solution is to check the
output for errors and if there are any, dump out the log file for the
user to see and let the user know there are errors.

Change-Id: I4db3f6ac7e9fe7cce6a432dfba056e17ad1e3f06
'}, {'created': '2020-06-29 18:46:27.000000000', 'message': 'Fix drop databases issue in Postgresql restore

Recently, the Postgresql backups were modified to generate drop database
commands (--clean pgdumpall option). Also for single database restore,
a DROP DATABASE command was added before the restore so that the
database could be restored without duplicate rows. However, if there are
existing database connections (by the applications or other users), then
the drop database commands will fail. So for the duration of the restore
database operation, the databases being restored need to have their
existing connections dropped and new connections prevented until the
database(s) restored, then connections should be re-allowed.

Also found a problem with psql returning 0 (success code) even though
there were errors during its execution. The solution is to check the
output for errors and if there are any, dump out the log file for the
user to see and let the user know there are errors.

Lastly, a problem was found with the single database restortion, where
the database dump for a single database was being incorrectly extracted
from the psql dump file, resulting in the database not being restored
correctly (most of the db being wiped out!). This patchset fixes that
issue as well.

Change-Id: I4db3f6ac7e9fe7cce6a432dfba056e17ad1e3f06

commit_message:
Fix drop databases issue in Postgresql restore

Recently, the Postgresql backups were modified to generate drop database
commands (--clean pgdumpall option). Also for single database restore,
a DROP DATABASE command was added before the restore so that the
database could be restored without duplicate rows. However, if there are
existing database connections (by the applications or other users), then
the drop database commands will fail. So for the duration of the restore
database operation, the databases being restored need to have their
existing connections dropped and new connections prevented until the
database(s) restored, then connections should be re-allowed.

Also found a problem with psql returning 0 (success code) even though
there were errors during its execution. The solution is to check the
output for errors and if there are any, dump out the log file for the
user to see and let the user know there are errors.

Lastly, a problem was found with the single database restortion, where
the database dump for a single database was being incorrectly extracted
from the psql dump file, resulting in the database not being restored
correctly (most of the db being wiped out). This patchset fixes that
issue as well.

Change-Id: I4db3f6ac7e9fe7cce6a432dfba056e17ad1e3f06

[{'created': '2020-07-01 15:27:40.000000000', 'message': 'Add links to chosen release names

We list the release name polling information details in a table, but no
where do we actually provide either the results or links to the results
for someone looking at the release naming process.

This updates the table to link the release letters to the mailing list
announcements declaring the winner of the poll.

Change-Id: Ib583f238134e90828d3be06c047938d7855889ec
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add links to chosen release names

We list the release name polling information details in a table, but no
where do we actually provide either the results or links to the results
for someone looking at the release naming process.

This updates the table to link the release letters to the mailing list
announcements declaring the winner of the poll.

Change-Id: Ib583f238134e90828d3be06c047938d7855889ec
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2020-06-30 17:30:31.000000000', 'message': 'Apply Octavia hacking checks to the tempest plugin

Currently we are not applying the custom hacking checks we use in
Octavia to the octavia-tempest-plugin. This leads to style issues
sneaking into the plugin.
This patch copies the same checks from Octavia (for simpler
management) into octavia-tempest-plugin and resolves some of the
existing style violations.

Change-Id: Ic103d8bededfec77ec0034d7c167ac1e49954a5c
'}, {'created': '2020-06-30 17:53:00.000000000', 'message': 'Apply Octavia hacking checks to the tempest plugin

Currently we are not applying the custom hacking checks we use in
Octavia to the octavia-tempest-plugin. This leads to style issues
sneaking into the plugin.
This patch copies the same checks from Octavia (for simpler

existing style violations.

Change-Id: Ic103d8bededfec77ec0034d7c167ac1e49954a5c
'}]
commit_message:
Apply Octavia hacking checks to the tempest plugin

Currently we are not applying the custom hacking checks we use in
Octavia to the octavia-tempest-plugin. This leads to style issues
sneaking into the plugin.
This patch copies the same checks from Octavia (for simpler
management) into octavia-tempest-plugin and resolves some of the
existing style violations.

Change-Id: Ic103d8bededfec77ec0034d7c167ac1e49954a5c

commit_message:
Limit the number of concurrent snapshots

This change introduces new [DEFAULT]/max_concurrent_snapshots parameter
in order to limit by default compute resource overuse related
to snapshot.

Implements: blueprint max-concurrent-snapshots

Change-Id: I40b8caf06ed525e97e871cf381776164208461fb

commit_message:
Add generate openAPIV3Schema schema for DaemonJob CRD.

change docker image to point to the latest metacontroller image.
change python image to point to version 3.7
add updateStrategy to CompositeController.
add replicas config to DaemonJobController via zuul gate.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-30 16:29:49.000000000', 'message': 'Fix return code when backup to remote rgw fails

In the database backup framework (_backup_main.sh.tpl), the
backup_databases function exits with code 1 if the store_backup_remotely
function fails to send the backup to the remote RGW. This causes the pod
to fail and be restarted by the cronjob, over and over until the backoff
retries limit (6 by default) is reached, so it creates many copies of
the same backup on the file system, and the default k8s behavior is to
delete the job/pods once the backoff limit has been exceeded, so it then
becomes more difficult to troubleshoot (although we may have logs in
elasticsearch). This patch changes the return code to 0 so that the pod
will not fail in that scenario. The error logs generated should be
enough to flag the failure (via Nagios or whatever alerting system is
being used).

Change-Id: Ie1c3a7aef290bf6de4752798821d96451c1f2fa5
'}]
commit_message:
Fix return code when backup to remote rgw fails

In the database backup framework (_backup_main.sh.tpl), the
backup_databases function exits with code 1 if the store_backup_remotely
function fails to send the backup to the remote RGW. This causes the pod
to fail and be restarted by the cronjob, over and over until the backoff
retries limit (6 by default) is reached, so it creates many copies of
the same backup on the file system, and the default k8s behavior is to
delete the job/pods once the backoff limit has been exceeded, so it then
becomes more difficult to troubleshoot (although we may have logs in
elasticsearch). This patch changes the return code to 0 so that the pod
will not fail in that scenario. The error logs generated should be
enough to flag the failure (via Nagios or whatever alerting system is
being used).

Change-Id: Ie1c3a7aef290bf6de4752798821d96451c1f2fa5

of https://keystone.example.com/v3), even if OS_IDENTITY_API is set to

(cherry picked from commit ad46262148e7b099e6c7239887e20ade5b8e6ac8)

commit_message:
Inject /v3 in token path for v3 plugins

Without this, it's possible to get HTTP 404 errors from keystone if
OS_AUTH_URL isn't versioned (e.g., https://keystone.example.com/ instead
of https://keystone.example.com/v3), even if OS_IDENTITY_API is set to
3.

This commit works around this issue by checking the AUTH_URL before
building the token_url and appending '/v3' to the URL before sending the
request.

Closes-Bug: 1876317

Change-Id: Ic75f0c9b36022b884105b87bfe05f4f8292d53b2
(cherry picked from commit ad46262148e7b099e6c7239887e20ade5b8e6ac8)
(cherry picked from commit 3ba2a3acf2a897de046873f3585463638e3567f6)

commit_message:
Get ports filtered by subnet id on share-server cleanup

Neutron can filter ports by subnet-id by itself, so:
- Don't send all ports in Neutron on every share-server removal
- Don't send fixed-ips fields (which are nearly half of total data)

Closes-Bug: #1879754
Change-Id: If42c9a0a662a62bbe2a02b6baee6ae13eedd8c97
Signed-off-by: George Melikov <mail@gmelikov.ru>
(cherry picked from commit d5fc7d28023fb060a077e7913c38b2aa59deae4b)
(cherry picked from commit 1c25df055cfcb4a99f6010dedd9698aeab582c9f)
(cherry picked from commit 6542f2f1c4a509c80531314a7e102ffbf62f02de)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-18 18:44:58.000000000', 'message': 'Workaround for TCP checksum issue with ovs-dpdk and veth pair

The need for this change stems from following issues:
1) When ovs_use_veth = False with ovs-dpdk issue with ovs
was observed - after vswitch restart interface is not comming up.
Meaning ovs-dpdk uses ovs internal ports andit is not able to bring
them up on restart.
2) When ovs_use_veth = True and ovs-dpkd is used, packets sent with
incorrect checksum due to the fact that ovs-dpdk does not do checksum
calculations for veth interface.

This commit allows to use second option and resolve checksum issue by
disabling checksum offload.
This approach was chosen after investigating

rendered as incorrect.

commit_message:
Workaround for TCP checksum issue with ovs-dpdk and  veth pair

The need for this change stems from following issues:
1) When ovs_use_veth = False with ovs-dpdk issue with ovs
was observed - after vswitch restart interface is not comming up.
Meaning ovs-dpdk uses ovs internal ports and it is not able to bring
them up on restart.
2) When ovs_use_veth = True and ovs-dpkd is used, packets sent with
incorrect checksum due to the fact that ovs-dpdk does not do checksum
calculations for veth interface.

This commit allows to use second option and resolve checksum issue by
disabling checksum offload.

Closes-Bug: #1832021
Related-Bug: #1831935

Change-Id: Iecce8d2c6c2c46718cc1020c6e8f914cd4560e4b
(cherry picked from commit 11838a2bc50caa40e776bce211f5f2d1d16a14af)

commit_message:
Add asynchronous error info into messages when share extend error

The database table messages is used to record various asynchronous error
messages, extend share is an asynchronously invoked procedure, when the
driver layer fails to execute extend share, we should record this
asynchronous error into database. This commit modify this behavior, and
now this asynchronows error is recorded in the database.

Closes-Bug:#1850264
Change-Id: I06a9bf24ab3d4aa5f4f5446d344bf55d71803e47
(cherry picked from commit be149c4c6bf354048bfb9f31d27c4a1b64de3fe1)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-25 21:38:30.000000000', 'message': "Add option to auto-load kernel modules for sysctl

The nf_conntrack module is not loaded early enough on boot,
thus when sysctl options are applied, its settings are not.

This results in the correct sysctl settings seen on deploy
time (because nf_conntrack was loaded previously by others)
but not after reboot, despite configured in /etc/sysctl.d/.

So, insert it in /etc/modules for module auto-load on boot
(available on Trusty via /etc/init/kmod.conf, then Xenial+
via systemd-sysctl.service).

Since users can configure the sysctl option and thus need
more modules, introduce the charm config option 'modules'
(with 'nf_conntrack' as default.)

It's handled before sysctl in the config-changed hook in
case some sysctl option(s) needs not yet loaded module(s).

In case of failure to load modules, do as currently done
for the plugin config.

Closes-Bug: #1885192
Change-Id: I661a4fe2d9284455e536b073dc93696355baf122
Signed-off-by: Mauricio Faria de Oliveira <mfo@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Add option to auto-load kernel modules for sysctl

The nf_conntrack module is not loaded early enough on boot,
thus when sysctl options are applied, its settings are not.

This results in the correct sysctl settings seen on deploy
time (because nf_conntrack was loaded previously by others)
but not after reboot, despite configured in /etc/sysctl.d/.

So, insert it in /etc/modules for module auto-load on boot
(available on Trusty via /etc/init/kmod.conf, then Xenial+
via systemd-sysctl.service).

Since users can configure the sysctl option and thus need
more modules, introduce the config option 'kernel-modules'
(with 'nf_conntrack' as default.)

It's handled before sysctl in the config-changed hook in
case some sysctl option(s) needs not yet loaded module(s).

In case of failure to load modules, log a warning message.

Closes-Bug: #1885192
Change-Id: I661a4fe2d9284455e536b073dc93696355baf122
Signed-off-by: Mauricio Faria de Oliveira <mfo@canonical.com>
